item.title: vCloud Networking and Security license in Evaluation Mode
item.description: A customer has a VMware vSphere 5.1 environment with VMware Horizon View 5.2 environment and Trend Micro Deep Security installed. Trend Micro Deep Security uses the VMware vShield Endpoint framework. In the vSphere license manager asset the “vCloud Networking and Security” license is displayed in evaluation mode and has a expire date. This is strange because vSphere 5.1 > includes a vShield Endpoint license. So no extra vShield licenses are required.

item.title: Enable the vShield driver in VMware tools
item.description: One of the steps of a vShield Endpoint based deployment is to enable the vShield driver in VMware tools. The vShield driver is not enabled by default. This can be done manually or automatically for example in the golden image of a VDI desktop.
